Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek ostracon
Description: This fragment of Greek ostracon coming from Thebes and dating from the 2nd century of our era contains an account of wine. It concerns a delivery of a quantity of wine to several people and for several uses during the period of one month. Several terms of the document show that the transactions took place in the milieu of weavers.
